title: Noli Me Tángere
excerpt: A sweeping social novel exposing the injustices of colonial Philippine society through memorable characters such as Crisóstomo Ibarra and María Clara.

title: El Filibusterismo
excerpt: A darker sequel to Noli that follows the vengeful Simoun and argues for systemic reform amid mounting revolutionary fervor.

title: Mi Último Adiós
excerpt: Rizal's farewell poem composed on the eve of his execution, invoking love of country, sacrifice, and hope for liberation.

title: La Indolencia de los Filipinos
excerpt: A serialized essay in La Solidaridad arguing that Filipino indolence stems from colonial policies, forced labor, and climate, not innate laziness.

title: Annotations to Antonio de Morga's Sucesos de las Islas Filipinas
excerpt: Rizal's meticulous annotations reclaim Filipino agency by highlighting precolonial achievements erased from colonial narratives.
